result.execSummary:
The defendant Maylon W Davis III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 11/21/16 Crt extends probation for 6 mo (from 12/16/16 to 6/16/17) or until parenting classes have been successfully completed, whichever comes first..

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge remitted. $243  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
No corporal punishment. No unsupervised contact with RAD unless approved by agent in writing.

Parenting Class.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maylon W Davis III

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
  Information was filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
  Defendant advised of right to and waived (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; State's witness hasn't shown, State requests a setover of PH; Atty Rios moves to dismiss and offers argument; CT notes bond conditions & questions parties; parties respond; further argument by Atty Rios to dismiss; Ct finds good cause to setover PH; notice given to parties in court; Ct adjourned.

Defendant in court with Attorney Anthony Christopher Rios.  Paul W. Humphrey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence against R.A.D. or E.E.D.
- Defendant shall not have any contact with R.A.D. unless it is supervised by a responsible adult.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 5

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Tim Helmberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
